messages.title: A MANIFESTO FOR THE MANY, NOT THE FEW

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ban zero hour contracts, Pension triple lock guaranteed, no tax increases if you earn under £80,000, a £10 minimum wage from 18+ by 2020, Public ownership of bus, rail, energy, water and Royal Mail.

No student tuition fees from September 2017, Real funding increase of 6% per pupil in schools, Free hot lunch for all primary school children, Free child care: 30 hrs for all 2-4 year olds, Free college courses for adult learners for life.

Stop the Dorset 'STP' plan to close hospital units & GPs, Invest £38bn more in the NHS and integrated Social Care, Give NHS workers the pay they deserve, Restore nurse training bursaries, End the scandalous neglect of mental health.

issues.education: No student tuition fees from September 2017, Real funding increase of 6% per pupil in schools, Free hot lunch for all primary school children, Free child care: 30 hrs for all 2-4 year olds, Free college courses for adult learners for life.
issues.health: Stop the Dorset 'STP' plan to close hospital units & GPs, Invest £38bn more in the NHS and integrated Social Care, Give NHS workers the pay they deserve, Restore nurse training bursaries, End the scandalous neglect of mental health.

leaflet.personalStatement: Steve moved to Poole with his family 11 years ago, to enjoy the clean air, countryside and beaches of Dorset. Steve's wife is an English teacher and Labour campaigner. Steve is a Project Manager who has worked in manufacturing industries for 25 years, including a spell at the RNLI in Poole. He commutes regularly to London now, having faced the insecurities typical of modern long-term contract work in recent times. Steve is a life-long Labour supporter who really became active in campaigns after the financial crash revealed to him some truths which strengthened his understanding and brought home the significance of the issue. Since then he has campaigned and fought for fairness and justice in society.
